meanings.definition: To mourn or lament in a poem or song.
meanings.sent1: She elegises the loss of her pet in a heartfelt poem.
meanings.sent2: The poet elegises the fallen soldiers in his latest work.
meanings.sent3: At the poetry reading, she elegises her broken phone with exaggerated sorrow.
meanings.sent4: The melody elegises the fading sunlight as the day comes to an end.
meanings.sent5: His voice elegises the beauty of nature in every verse he sings.

meanings.definition: To express sorrow or grief in a formal manner.
meanings.sent1: The family elegises the passing of their beloved grandmother with a touching eulogy.
meanings.sent2: During the funeral, they elegises the loss of a dear friend with deep sadness.
meanings.sent3: He elegises the burnt toast as if it were a national tragedy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds elegises the impending storm on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes elegises the pain she feels, even though she tries to smile.
